fields.title: Illustration - Cat - New Year
fields.description: Video recording of drawing the Chinese New Year portrait.

content.value: From this, we carried out investigations into the movements and textures of these eight elements. The discoveries contributed to prototypes of generative expressions, maintaining cyclical movements in the form of S, 8, and infinity while mirroring a continuum that connects the digital and physical worlds.

fields.title: Innovation
fields.description: The world-first, scientifically accurate, fully 3D, real-time Age Simulation Engine.

content.value: The foundation of this technology lies in a century of Shiseido’s extensive scientific research on skin science and knowledge from experts in senescence technology from Hokkaido Information University.

After researching and surveying, we realized many innovative works within R/GA came from cross-disciplinary collaborations. Thus, we highlighted and color-coded 5 major disciplines  (business & marketing, production, strategy, design, and technology) in the dataset.

fields.title: Data Processing
fields.description: Make sense of data of cross-office collaboration.

fields.summary: Zig - Design System - Comparison to Flutter Library

content.value: We verified every component based on Google Flutter’s existing widgets early when creating wireframes to guarantee components’ feasibility. All components tightly ‘fit’ the Flutter library but with an entirely distinct, branded look and feel.

fields.title: Deliverables
fields.description: Final data visualizations in different camera angles.

content.value: More directions were explored as design experiments and to showcase the versatility of the prototype. These variations offer diverse tones of voice: for instance, the poster in the middle of slide 3 embracing the theme “Orchestra of Collaboration” is in the form of musical notations.

In addition to the live data visualization, which is dynamic and moving, we also designed a static version, which condensed 3 years’ data to 1 single image, just like a timelapse photo. The title “Collaborate to Innovate” was designed to frame the poster to enhance aesthetics.

fields.title: Deliverable - Carousel of poster variations
captions: Main static poster, condensing 3 years’ data to 1 single image.
Variations of static posters, set 1.
Variations of static posters, set 2.

content.value: All these versions tell meaningful stories about R/GA APAC: for example, with the bird’s eye view in 2019, you can see the Melbourne office came up and collaborated intensively with the Sydney office across Technology and Design.

fields.title: Deliverable - 2017 - 2019 Data Visualization (3 Views)
fields.description: Data visualization between 2017/01 - 2019/10 (Front View, Perspective View, Bird View)

content.value: The perspective view provides an overview of how multiple offices collaborate at a specific point in time.
The front view lives close to the traditional form of the sound wave. When multiple conversations are happening concurrently, the entire visualization looks like an orchestra with rich textures.

fields.title: Carousel of interactive web experience
captions: Interactive web experience, interface design 1
Interactive web experience, interface design 2

fields.title: Poster - AR Layer Breakdown
fields.caption: Breakdown of all the layers in the AR poster.

fields.title: AR Video of Vision Poster
fields.description: AR version of the Vision Poster.

content.value: Besides those versions above, we extended the data visualization to AR and interactive web experiences. Those experiments approve again how a system of data visualization can be scalable and live in different mediums.

fields.title: Prototyping
fields.description: Use data to power a generative design exercise with TouchDesigner.

content.value: Here is an example of the prototype, which is a snapshot of the entire timelapse. At this time point, collaborations in technology and creative, represented by purple lines and red lines respectively, were happening between the Singapore and Tokyo offices. The density and length of waves are defined by the number of hours the collaboration sustained.

fields.title: Carousel of Logic in TouchDesigner
captions: The overview of the TouchDesigner project.
Use Sine wave in TouchDesigner to translate data to sound waves.
Post-processing of waves to remove meaningless visuals and enhance aesthetics.
Final output waves in TouchDesigner, which become more organic and dynamic.

content.value: Sine waves were used as the primary geometry in TouchDesigner to produce sound waves, with the colors defining different disciplines. Collaborations in 5 disciplines are translated to parallel waves, connecting R/GA offices across Asia-Pacific.
Inspired by the geographical positions of 5 offices, we structured the visualization in a pentagon shape.

fields.title: Poster - Pentagon Structure of Office Locations
Design - Sound wave as sculptures
captions: The sound wave of collaboration in single descipline between two offices.
The sound waves of collaboration in multiple desciplines between two offices.
The sound waves of collaboration shaped in a sound sculpture.
A close view of the sound sculpture.

fields.summary: Design - Reason to choose the sound wave

content.value: In this sense, we chose the sound wave as the form to visualize conversations, representing the pulse of collaborations. The sound wave expresses transmissions of information and reflects the process of exchanging and building-up. It is a form that can be easily translated, replicated in various ways, such as being used to shape a sound sculpture.
Collaboration invokes conversations. Conversely, conversations tighten collaboration and spark new ideas.

fields.title: Poster - Timeline of Sorted Data
fields.caption: R/GA Reporter Data in Timeline View

content.value: The original data details every individual’s contribution to projects in the aspects of the role, time, and duration. We assessed, cleaned, and grouped the data in a more understandable form: a timeline ranging from January 2017 to October 2019, recording monthly collaborations across 5 Asia-Pacific offices.
We retrieved data from R/GA Reporter, which is part of R/GA OS and a database containing collaboration data for every office.

fields.title: Concept
fields.description: How to define “Collaboration to Innovate” for R/GA?

fields.summary: Concept - We designed the poster to focus on cross-office collaborations.

content.value: We found that while R/GA OS helps the day-to-day operations, it also retains historical collaboration data. Therefore, we designed the poster to visualize these data, which helps showcase this collaboration across offices to clients and others.

fields.summary: Concept - Define “Collaboration to Innovate” for R/GA

content.value: R/GA is a network agency where offices work as one entity globally with the help of the R/GA OS, a suite of tools that allows for easy collaboration across.

fields.title: Background
fields.description: An initiative to convey the key vision “Collaboration to Innovate” via poster.

content.value: The project came from R/GA APAC’s regional initiative to create a Vision Art poster conveying the theme “Collaborate to  Innovate.” Instead of crafting a static poster, we decided to embody the theme in the process of creating the poster, combining design with technology to build something new.

fields.title: Results
fields.description: Over 13000 impressions on social media, and new businesses!

content.value: After the project was shared on Linkedin and Instagram, it immediately received more than 13000 impressions and was highlighted by TouchDesigner's official Instagram account. More surprisingly, it attracted new businesses to R/GA Singapore office: some clients approached us for opportunities in innovation after coming across the project on social media.
Data visualization is an excellent form to combine story and system: It can translate complicated concepts and data to simple messages and can grow into a visual system that is logical and scalable.

Collaboration between technologists and designers can effectively free up the imagination and creativity of both technologists and designers. In this case, with the proper collaborative process and setups, we were able to create a vast amount of assets relatively quickly and intuitively, which will take an exponentially longer amount of time in a traditional way using photoshop or illustrator.

AR is an effective media to connect physical and digital worlds. In this case, after being translated into AR, the data visualization becomes more tangible and enables the audience to observe the data freely from different angles and scales.
I picked up TouchDesigner in a week.

With this collaborative process, we reduce the delay between ideation to execution. Whenever we landed on a particular idea, we directly moved ahead and implemented it. This inclusive way of working empowered us to boost our best creativity and productivity.

fields.summary: Collaboration - Collaborated closely with Jeremy Lin

content.value: In this project, I collaborated closely with Jeremy Lin, a senior designer in R/GA Singapore. Instead of drawing a line between technology and design, we involved each other through the entire process. We ideated together, drew sketches together on whiteboards, solved problems together.

fields.title: Personal Portfolio
fields.description: Evidence of learning the latest web frameworks.

content.value: The website was designed with Figma and implemented with Vue.js and Nuxt.js frameworks for better performance and stability. The home page is a web canvas showing Three.js animations and interactions. The other pages are composed of modular components customized based on Vuetify.js, where data from Contentful fully control all the content and page layout.
My current portfolio site is evidence of learning some latest frameworks and tools of web developments, such as Vue.js, Nuxt.js, and Contentful.

fields.title: Personal Portfolio - Structure Image
fields.caption: Main components of the portfolio site.

fields.title: Google Standards
fields.description: A central hub from Google serving over 200,000 users.

content.value: From the project, I thoroughly learned the standard approach from one of the world’s top tech companies for code review, unit tests, website development, and deployment. At the same time, by learning Google’s standards, I deepened my understanding of Google’s comprehensive design system and honed my programming skills in general.

Working with another developer, we completely rebuilt and migrated the entire site (over 400 pages) using Google’s latest framework, component library, and CMS. The loading time of the site has improved by 50%. Content editors can make changes with no developer involvement. The workflow for maintenance and upgrade is much more familiar to any other Google developer, which widely extends the website’s lifespan.
Its original website was built on legacy code and architecture. Its complete-bespoke CSS and components, and lack of CMS result in high rates of regression and constant need for maintenance.

The Google Standards website is a centralized hub for Google brand guidelines and standards, covering branding, hardware, marketing, material design system, and other platforms and products. It serves all the Google’s internal employees, vendors, contractors, and partners (estimated over 200,000 users). It is a host to Google’s guidelines for virtually all the topics concerning how to develop, design, build, and market for Google.

fields.title: Team Kaleidoscope
fields.description: The first time for R/GA APAC to integrate Alibaba Cloud services.

content.value: I built the entire infrastructure independently as it is the first time for R/GA APAC to integrate Alibaba Cloud cloud services into the workflow. The website is also one of the first steps to establish the R/GA's lean stack offering in Asia-Pacific.

I was responsible for building this serverless infrastructure using Alibaba Cloud services, which handle user authentication, password encryption, access control of frontend developers, and CMS content retrieving & processing.

fields.title: Kaleidoscope - System structure
fields.caption: Structure of the serverless infrastructure using Alibaba Cloud and Contentful services.

fields.summary: Kaleidoscope - The ask from the team

content.value: The ask from the team is to provide a secure/restricted web portal that allows the team to iterate over design and content continuously with minimum cost. Based on the request, we implemented a static single-page microsite with a login screen, which adopts the headless CMS (contentful) and serverless infrastructure to have the best flexibility, security, usability, and lowest cost (almost $0 running cost).

fields.summary: Kaleidoscope - Website built for R/GA’s pitch

content.value: “Team Kaleidoscope” is a website built for R/GA’s pitch for the University of Melbourne.

fields.title: Team Kaleidoscope - Carousel of pages
captions: The website is accessible across different devices.
User authentication page and content page of the website.

fields.title: Concept
fields.description: Promote a deeper definition of “beauty” with an emotional time-travel experience.

content.value: As one of Japan’s most iconic brands in the beauty category, Shiseido has committed to broadening the definition of future beauty. To achieve the objective, we decided to build an interactive installation that re-defines beauty by encouraging the recognition of beauty in aging and changes people’s perception of one of the world’s oldest cosmetic companies.

Japan has the world’s fastest aging population. Yet 9 out of 10 Japanese fear growing old. In culture and advertising, “Beauty” is always narrowly defined as a youthful face with perfect skin, which makes people forget that aging can be beautiful as well.

Beyond Time also proves that design, experience, and technology can work seamlessly to bring about art, innovation, and science to the public. The project is a testimony to the process of combining research and development while taking on complex challenges and deep technologies to bring about an exciting and new outcome.

In one year since its launch, Beyond Time has engaged over 10,000 people in emotional experience and showed them a more positive way of looking at growing old via over 30,000 different conversations about aging. More importantly, we helped the iconic Shiseido brand make a sociocultural statement that beauty can be discovered in aging, not only in youth.

fields.title: Collaboration
fields.description: A close collaboration between design and technology

content.value: I worked closely with the design team to translate the innovations and scientific research behind the experience into an exhibition held on the 2nd floor, where visitors can learn all the technologies in an engaging way.

fields.title: Beyond Time - Collaboration with Design
captions: Architecture: Embedding sensors and technical components seamlessly in the installation.
Copy: Designing a conversation matrix to match questions to all possible scenarios.
Visual: Utilized shader prototypes to determine design and visual effects while balancing feasibility.
UX: Conducting tests to provide key insights that inform the design of the final experience.

content.value: Across the entire project, I collaborated deeply with the design team in architecture, user experience, conversation design, user interface, motion design.

fields.title: Background
fields.description: A Samsung installation in partnership with renowned photographer Carlos Serrao, to feature Galaxy S7 mobile phone.

fields.title: Beyond Time - Aging Research Video
fields.description: Research - How Japanese's facial wrinkles and spots change across different age stages

content.value: With face captured and rendered in 3D, our engine can accurately reflect environmental lighting, track minor facial expressions, and generate dynamic skin wrinkling in the real-time renderings. It creates the degree of realism that we needed for participants to truly engage one another in an emotional experience through various life stages.

fields.title: Beyond Time - Age Simulation Tech Overview

content.value: One of the core innovations in this project is a bespoke 3D facial age simulation engine I developed from scratch for the experience.

fields.summary: Innovation - Led the creation of our method

content.value: Leveraging the most recent technologies in computer vision, face tracking, and CG rendering, I led the creation of our unique, innovative age simulation which reproduces the derived aging process digitally on a user's face in 3D and in real-time.

fields.title: Beyond Time - Tech Overview and Summary
fields.caption: Detailed technologies used in the age simulation engine.

content.value: Beneath its minimalist exterior, the installation contains a considerable amount of technology, including depth cameras, high-resolution color cameras, sensor-based interface, and variable-opacity privacy glass for a fully immersive experience.

To power our aging simulation engine, I designed and developed a 3D facial data capture solution, faster and easier to operate. With this customized solution, we collected a vast 3D face database from over 500 actual Japanese people and extracted aging features from those data using advanced pattern detection algorithms. With all those combined efforts, we managed to derive a pattern on how Japanese faces are generally aged.
